title: Sound Cards and Motherboards
question_text: A Tech company produces sound cards and motherboards. It was concerned about how many parts were coming out defective. A manager randomly selected $78$ sound cards and $58$ motherboards. The manager found $8$ defective soundcards and $5$ defective motherboards. What statistical technique should be used to see if there is a difference between these products in terms of defects?

choices.text:
A two-sample
t
-test for a difference between two population proportions.

A two-sample
z
-test for a difference between two population proportions.

A two-sample
t
-test for a difference between two population means.

A two-sample
z
-test for a difference between two population means.
